tool.name: SnpSift Annotate

param.name: input
param.label: Variant input file in VCF format

param.name: dbSnp
param.label: VCF File with ID field annotated (e.g. dnSNP.vcf)
param.help: The ID field for a variant in input will be assigned from a matching variant in this file.

param.name: id
param.label: Only annotate ID field (do not add INFO field)

param.name: info_ids
param.label: Limit INFO annotation to these INFO IDs
param.help: list is a comma separated list of fields. When blank, all INFO fields are included

param.name: annotate_cmd
param.label: Allow unsorted VCF files
param.help: This option will load the entire 'database' VCF file into memory (which may not be practical for large 'database' VCF files). Otherwise, both the database and the input VCF files should be sorted by position (Chromosome sort order can differ between files).

tool.help:
This is typically used to annotate IDs from dbSnp.
Annotatating only the ID field from dbSnp137.vcf ::
Input VCF: CHROM POS ID REF ALT QUAL FILTER INFO 22 16157571 . T G 0.0 FAIL NS=53 22 16346045 . T C 0.0 FAIL NS=244 22 16350245 . C A 0.0 FAIL NS=192
Annotated Output VCF: #CHROM POS ID REF ALT QUAL FILTER INFO 22 16157571 . T G 0.0 FAIL NS=53 22 16346045 rs56234788 T C 0.0 FAIL NS=244 22 16350245 rs2905295 C A 0.0 FAIL NS=192
Annotatating both the ID and INFO fields from dbSnp137.vcf ::
